thread.title: Arsenal are the Premier League's best when it comes to scoring HEADED goals
thread.title_full: Arsenal are the Premier League's best when it comes to scoring HEADED goals

author: Richard Innes
title: Arsenal are the Premier League's best when it comes to scoring HEADED goals
text:
Arsenal are the Premier League's best when it comes to scoring HEADED goals Yes, really… Arsene Wenger's side are top of the Premier League table for scoring headers Share Arsenal players REALLY know how to use their heads (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get Arsenal FC   Could   
We all know the sort of goal Arsenal have tended to score over the years. 
Arsene Wenger's sides have always focused on knocking the ball about on the floor. As such, the typical Gunners goal features some quick passing in midfield to pull the opposition apart, a Santi Cazorla/Mesut Ozil through ball that gets them in behind the defence, a Theo Walcott/Alexis Sanchez cut back and a tap-in for Danny Welbeck/Olivier Giroud. 
Right? Apparently not. 
Incredibly, when you look at a (very specific) Premier League table, you see that Arsenal score more of a certain type of goal than any other team. 
HEADED goals. Olivier Giroud's equaliser vs Bournemouth: actually a very typical Arsenal goal (Photo: Michael Steele) 
Since the start of 2013/14 - so, over the course of the last four seasons - Arsenal have scored 46 headed goals. 
That puts them ahead of West Ham (who have Andy Carroll) and West Brom (who have Tony Pulis), two sides you might expect to be near the top of the list. But… Arsenal? Most headed goals since August 2013 Arsenal
